ratings.comment: Very Good Professor!
This is an awesome professor. He is extremely clear and helpful, and obviously puts a lot of effort into doing his job well. He tells stories and gives out candy to make lecture more fun.
Livens up some otherwise dull material
Great class

I like him in terms of how he presents the idea and application of economic theory. But the exams are so ****ingly hard. I've studied all day and only end up getting B. Though, he is nice professor. He's really helpful. If you got problem understanding the subject, meet him NOT the TAs.

Cool guy, good teaching methods, fair homework and exams. He makes the 75 minute lecture bearable with appropriate examples and occasionally strays off topic to break the monotony. Exams are pretty hard but they aren't tricky; study like you know you should and you'll do well. Written homework every week isn't too bad. Seek help when you need it!

Funny professor. Cracks jokes often which lives up power lectures. Makes a dry subject somewhat interesting and gives good example problems. Attendance isn't necessary since all lecture slides are online

Overall, Prof Scholz was pretty lame. The lectures were moderately interesting but not enough to keep my interest for the entire power lecture. The pace was way too slow. Tests were very difficult. You either like him alot or not at all. I fell in the latter. Avoid econ altogether if you can. It is harder than you think

Awesome prof! Lectures are kept interesting and interactive.  Relate directly to assignments and exams.  Discussion sections sucked but that's not his fault.  Test required knowledge of material and basic math but fair and straightforward with that.  Text was cheap and useful for introducing material but not required.  Read to help understand.
Really cares about students, wants us to learn. Willing to put in extra time to make accommodations for you. Interacts with students, even in large lectures.

Scholz is funny and all that but this is a really hard class. The textbook is useless, the exams are all math and the powerpoints barely cover the exam material. Go to the BLC (business learning center in grainger) and enroll in joe's extra help class, it will save your ass.

He keeps lecture interesting, but other than that his class sucks. Exams are hard and lecture and discussion rarely cover the homework. I had to work my ass off in this class and came out with a C. DO NOT TAKE.

Prof. Scholz is awesome!  One of the most passionate instructors on campus, he really loves to teach.  He makes lecture interesting.  Exams are entirely math based, and fair, but difficult.  The textbook is rather worthless, but it is very inexpensive.  Great curve compared to other introductory classes.
Good professor, and made subject interesting. I really enjoyed his class. Exams were difficult, but if you knew the material you would do good. The textbook is not very good, but its free.

I really like Scholz, he made lecture interesting was generally good at explaining the material. Go to lecture if you want to get better than a B in the class, because studying from the book is useless.

Prof Scholz is an all around great guy. I really enjoyed going to his class and found his lectures very interesting. His tests are hard and extremely math based (and you can't use a calculator which is annoying), but his curves are huge and you can drop the lowest score. I definitely recomment this guy! He's funny, caring, and attractive too ;)

Great professor, the one class I didn't mind going to lecture for. He kept class fun with jokes and candy for trivia once in a while. Friendly, easy to talk to, cares about teaching. Go to lecture (don't have to really read the book) and you will do fine.

Dr. Scholz is the best teacher I have.  Lectures are fantastic and amazingly helpful.  He posts his power points and lecture videos online.  Don't get me wrong his exams are hard but he drops your lowest one.  Take his class.

Prof. Scholz was the best professor that I've ever had. The man manages to make a full power lecture interesting. He's a funny guy, is extremely passionate about his subject. The tests are easy if you go to the review sessions and do the practice exams. If you have the option, you need to take Prof. Scholz for Econ 101.

Class is interesting throughout the entire semester. Professor is funny and fair minded until the end of the class. In the last unit the lectures are insufferable as the professor editorializes way too much. Exams are hard.

Class sucks. Don't take it unless you are actually interested/have a background in economics... Exams are really tough as they are entirely math based and he teaches theory during lecture instead of the math concepts that are actually on the exam.

Cool guy, funny, makes econ fun in lectures but exams are hard (but you can drop one!) Gives candy once and a while for trivia questions.  I think I know more about his personal life then any of my other professors but he keeps it interesting. If you're not an econ major and can take another class to satisfy this criteria then do that.
Great Professor. Makes sure to explain all math and almost all concepts. Makes classes fun. Possibly a part-time comedian. For a boring subject he sure livened it up a little.
Minimal homework. Listen to lectures, and do the 15 minutes of reading twice a week and you will get an AB. For an A just read the book along with going to lecture.

Hard class. He tries to make it interesting. Homework and tests suck. His lectures are mostly conceptual, but the tests are all solving math problems. Can't use a calculator on tests which really makes it a lot harder even though he tries to use simple math.

Professor Scholz is an awesome guy. He keeps lectures interesting for the most part, but some can get very dry (economics in general). Hard exams in my opinion, and definitely not an easy A. Change your TA if you don't like yours, most aren't helpful.

He is a funny professor who keeps lectures interesting. It is clear that he wants students to learn the material. Helps connect information to real world examples. Form a study group, because TAs are not too helpful.

Scholz keeps the lectures interesting, but you still have to do the homework and read if you want to get an A. The class is very fair, but I would recommend getting a tutor because most of the TAs aren't very good.
Tries very hard to be funny, even though he's really not. But he makes lecture interesting and is overall a good professor.
Hilarious professor!
Very fun teacher. Use the charts throughout the chapter as examples for the homework problems. Homework isn't that bad but the tests are pretty hard. Overall its an easy class for econ.
My TA sucked.  Go to Jonathan's class if you can.  Scholz was funny.  Tests were somewhat challenging (other than the first) but the curve was big.

He trys very hard to make the lectures interesting, "win your professors candy" was a game played every week. The homeworks take a while and the tests suck, mainly due to time constraints and no calculator. The curves were pretty good though. Hard but fair class

I loved Professor John Karl Scholz!  He did a great job of explaining material clearly (sometimes he was a bit too thorough).  The homework sort of sucked and so did my TA.  Be sure to switch to one that you like if yours sucks.  Overall Professor Scholz was a great teacher... he is funny and cute too!
Very easy professor for econ.  I only went to class a couple times.  Read the book and get an A.
Decent professor, tried way too hard to make the lecture interesting. test curves are pretty wonderful. overall, the class was mediocre.

Great professor!  Trys very hard and succeeds in making lecture very interesting and energetic, which is hard with econ.  Homework can take a while and tests are rather hard-bc of time limits and no calculator, even though he tries to keep the math simple. Good guy!

Great professor.  I'd take him again because he tries really hard to make econ interesting and he is VERY helpful.  I hardly put any time into the class and get ABs on all the tests with a generous curve.
Hard tests because of the time constraints.  Homework does not show up on the tests.  Curve is big. Dont get a non-English speaking TA.
Scholz is the best professor - econ sucks but it isnt his fault. He has great ways of explaining concepts and is hilarious. Get him for econ if you can!
Very easy to understand and review sessions were helpful.  For early lectures he has a lot of energy and great sense of humor.  Good class to wake you up.

Decent lecturer, but lectures are not necessary, as he teaches straight from the book. So, you can skip and just read the chapter instead. Test questions are often very poorly written, which can be frustrating, but he makes up for it when he can.
he teachs straight out of the book and cant really answer student questions in class. the homework is irrelavent to the exams which are hard and you dont get enough time.

Alright professor. Tests are difficult, but the curve is HUGE! Basically teaches straight from the book which kinda sucks, and hw is long. I didnt like the class, but thats partly due to the fact that econ sucks.

Lectures are clear, but he basically dictates the chapters from the book. Only gives a few examples of problems that are on the homework, otherwise you have to figure them out for yourself. Homework takes FOREVER. He's a nice guy, but doesn't teach how to do problems, which make up all of the exams.

best econ prof ever! interesting, funny, very helpful, tests are similar to practice exams, fair... everything you hope for from a professor. he makes a sincere attempt to get to know his students if you go to his office hours, and he often gives away free candy during lecture!
VERY good teacher...easy to understand and funny. definitely take this prof.
Scholz is the man, a **** if you will
No Comments
